Member Function Documentation

template<class SOCHAR>
void CSimpleOptTempl< SOCHAR >::Init ( int  a_argc,
SOCHAR *  a_argv[],
const SOption *  a_rgOptions,
int  a_nFlags = 0 
) [inline]

Initialize the class in preparation for calling Next.

The table of options pointed to by a_rgOptions does not need to be valid at the time that Init() is called. However on every call to Next() the table pointed to must be a valid options table with the last valid entry set to SO_END_OF_OPTIONS.

NOTE: the array pointed to by a_argv will be modified by this class and must not be used or modified outside of member calls to this class.

Parameters:
a_argc Argument array size
a_argv Argument array
a_rgOptions Valid option array
a_nFlags Optional flags to modify the processing of the arguments

template<class SOCHAR>
bool CSimpleOptTempl< SOCHAR >::Next (  )  [inline]

Advance to the next option if available.

When all options have been processed it will return false. When true has been returned, you must check for an invalid or unrecognized option using the LastError() method. This will be return an error value other than SO_SUCCESS on an error. All standard data (e.g. OptionText(), OptionArg(), OptionId(), etc) will be available depending on the error.

After all options have been processed, the remaining files from the command line can be processed in same order as they were passed to the program.

Returns:
true option or error available for processing

false all options have been processed

00485                 nTableIdx = LookupOption(m_pszOptionText);
00486 
00487                 // if we didn't find this option but if it is a short form

00490                         && !m_pszOptionArg

00495                 {
00496                         // test for a short-form with argument if appropriate
00497                         if (HasFlag(SO_O_SHORTARG)) {
00498                                 m_szShort[1] = m_pszOptionText[1];
00499                                 int nIdx = LookupOption(m_szShort);
00500                                 if (nIdx >= 0
00501                                         && (m_rgOptions[nIdx].nArgType == SO_REQ_CMB

00503                                 {
00504                                         m_pszOptionArg  = &m_pszOptionText[2];
00505                                         m_pszOptionText = m_szShort;
00506                                         nTableIdx       = nIdx;
00507                                 }
00508                         }
00509 
00510                         // test for a clumped short-form option string and we didn't
00511                         // match on the short-form argument above
00512                         if (nTableIdx < 0 && HasFlag(SO_O_CLUMP))  {
00513                                 m_pszClump = &m_pszOptionText[1];
00514                                 ++m_nNextOption;
00515                                 if (nOptIdx > m_nOptionIdx) {
00516                                         ShuffleArg(m_nOptionIdx, nOptIdx - m_nOptionIdx);
00517                                 }
00518                                 return Next();
00519                         }
00520                 }
00521 
00522                 // The option wasn't found. If it starts with a switch character
00523                 // and we are not suppressing errors for invalid options then it
00524                 // is reported as an error, otherwise it is data.
00525                 if (nTableIdx < 0) {
00526                         if (!HasFlag(SO_O_NOERR) && m_pszOptionText[0] == (SOCHAR)'-') {
00527                                 break;
00528                         }
00529                         m_pszOptionText[0] = cFirst;
00530                         ++nOptIdx;
00531                         if (m_pszOptionArg) {
00532                                 *(--m_pszOptionArg) = (SOCHAR)'=';
00533                         }
00534                 }
00535         }
00536 
00537         // end of options
00538         if (nOptIdx >= m_nLastArg) {
00539                 if (nOptIdx > m_nOptionIdx) {
00540                         ShuffleArg(m_nOptionIdx, nOptIdx - m_nOptionIdx);
00541                 }
00542                 return false;
00543         }
00544         ++m_nNextOption;
00545 
00546         // get the option id
00547         ESOArgType nArgType = SO_NONE;
00548         if (nTableIdx < 0) {
00549                 m_nLastError = (ESOError) nTableIdx; // error code
00550         }
00551         else {
00552                 m_nOptionId     = m_rgOptions[nTableIdx].nId;
00553                 m_pszOptionText = m_rgOptions[nTableIdx].pszArg;
00554 
00555                 // ensure that the arg type is valid
00556                 nArgType = m_rgOptions[nTableIdx].nArgType;
00557                 switch (nArgType) {
00558 case SO_NONE:
00559         if (m_pszOptionArg) {
00560                 m_nLastError = SO_ARG_INVALID;
00561         }
00562         break;
00563 
00564 case SO_REQ_SEP:
00565         if (m_pszOptionArg) {
00566                 // they wanted separate args, but we got a combined one, unless
00567                 // we are being pedantic about things, just accept it.
00568                 if (HasFlag(SO_O_PEDANTIC)) {
00569                         m_nLastError = SO_ARG_INVALID_TYPE;
00570                 }
00571         }
00572         // more processing after we shuffle
00573         break;
00574 
00575 case SO_REQ_CMB:
00576         if (!m_pszOptionArg) {
00577                 m_nLastError = SO_ARG_MISSING;
00578         }
00579         break;
00580 
00581 case SO_OPT:
00582         // nothing to do
00583         break;
00584 
00585 case SO_MULTI:
00586         // nothing to do. Caller must now check for valid arguments
00587         // using GetMultiArg()
00588         break;
00589                 }
00590         }
00591 
00592         // shuffle the files out of the way
00593         if (nOptIdx > m_nOptionIdx) {
00594                 ShuffleArg(m_nOptionIdx, nOptIdx - m_nOptionIdx);
00595         }
00596 
00597         // we need to return the separate arg if required, just re-use the
00598         // multi-arg code because it all does the same thing
00599         if (nArgType == SO_REQ_SEP && !m_pszOptionArg && m_nLastError == SO_SUCCESS) {
00600                 SOCHAR ** ppArgs = MultiArg(1);
00601                 if (ppArgs) {
00602                         m_pszOptionArg = *ppArgs;
00603                 }
00604         }
00605 
00606         return true;
00607 }

template<class SOCHAR>
ESOError CSimpleOptTempl< SOCHAR >::LastError (  )  const [inline]

Return the last error that occurred.

This function must always be called before processing the current option. This function is available only when Next() has returned true.

Return the argument for the current option where one exists.

template<class SOCHAR>
SOCHAR ** CSimpleOptTempl< SOCHAR >::MultiArg ( int  n  )  [inline]

Validate and return the desired number of arguments.

This is only valid when OptionId() has return the ID of an option that is registered as SO_MULTI. It may be called multiple times each time returning the desired number of arguments. Previously returned argument pointers are remain valid.

If an error occurs during processing, NULL will be returned and the error will be available via LastError().

Parameters:
n Number of arguments to return.
